title: Moles of Fe3+ given Beer-Lambert plot absorbance

content.question: To determine the moles of Fe3+(aq) in a 100. mL sample of an unknown solution, excess KSCN(s) is added to convert all the Fe3+(aq) into the dark red species FeSCN2+(aq), as represented by the equation above. The absorbance of FeSCN2+(aq) at different concentrations is shown in the graph below. If the absorbance of the mixture is 0.20 at 453 nm, how many moles of Fe3+(aq) were present in the 100. mL sample? (Assume that any volume change due to adding the KSCN(s) is negligible.)

skill.text: 5.D: Identify information presented graphically to solve a problem.
